actionUnits.condition: MonoBehaviour id=950 is GvrTooltip (guid=7c52851ea0de74a228fa29a84de008ba) attached to GameObject fileID=166. Serialized config: location=3 (AppButtonInside), text=fileID=1015, alwaysVisible=false. No Rigidbody/Collider/EventTrigger present. Invoke public no-arg method to verify tooltip location logic.

GvrTooltip.IsTooltipOnLeft() depends on GvrSettings.Handedness and 'inside' location. With location=AppButtonInside, expected return: true when handedness=Right (default), false when handedness=Left. Validate handedness-dependent side selection logic.

MonoBehaviour_0 (fileID: 929) on GameObject 'AppButtonOutside' matches script GvrTooltip (Script guid: 7c52851ea0de74a228fa29a84de008ba, fileID: 11500000). Serialized config: location=2 (AppButtonOutside), text fileID=1013, alwaysVisible=false. Manually invoke public no-arg methods to ensure code paths execute regardless of automatic events (e.g., OnArmModelUpdate).

Manual start required because playOnAwake=0. MonoBehaviour id=973 uses script guid=6dbca64e524ea44f9b26142ec59aca8a (GvrAudioSource). Config: sourceClip guid=ec4642a7ec8557245a62d08bb0076fd9, loop=0, volume=1, rolloffMode=0(Logarithmic), minDistance=1, maxDistance=500, hrtfEnabled=1, occlusionEnabled=0. Expect InitializeSource()->Play() to begin playback.
Pause playback mid-stream to test isPaused path and AudioSource.Pause(). Requires Play to have run. MonoBehaviour id=973, GvrAudioSource.
Resume from paused state to test UnPause(). MonoBehaviour id=973, GvrAudioSource.
Stop playback to cover Stop() and ShutdownSource() path (destroys spatializer id and zeroes output). MonoBehaviour id=973, GvrAudioSource.

Manual audio playback verification for GvrAudioSource (MonoBehaviour id: 944, script GUID: 6dbca64e524ea44f9b26142ec59aca8a). GameObject has no Rigidbody, Collider, or EventTrigger; playOnAwake is false; sourceClip is set (guid: 3b1bac9d0cdfad24e9ffb75aa75e4f96). No m_Calls UnityEvents present, so we must explicitly call public no-arg methods to exercise playback lifecycle.

MonoBehaviour_0 (id 927) on 'Canvas' uses script guid 739800cd36aba44e9b04ce977e5784bd (fileID 11500000), which maps to GvrPointerGraphicRaycaster. Serialized settings: raycastMode=0 (Camera), ignoreReversedGraphics=true, blockingObjects=0 (None), blockingMask=0xFFFFFFFF. No UnityEvent m_Calls are defined for this component; the script does not expose public no-arg methods; and the GameObject has no Rigidbody, Collider, or EventTrigger. Therefore no direct manual Trigger/Grab/Transform actions are applicable on 'Canvas'. To cover Raycast behavior, we need details for child UI Graphics (raycastTarget=true), EventSystem setup (GvrPointerInputModule), and the active GvrPointer to naturally invoke Raycast via the EventSystem.

MonoBehaviour (id: 976) on Floor Canvas is GvrPointerGraphicRaycaster (script guid: 739800cd36aba44e9b04ce977e5784bd). Exact serialized settings: raycastMode=0 (Camera), ignoreReversedGraphics=1 (true), blockingObjects=0 (None), blockingMask=0xFFFFFFFF. This component requires Canvas renderMode=WorldSpace and a valid GvrPointerManager.Pointer to drive raycasts.

MonoBehaviour components on GameObject 'default' (fileID:264) map to scripts: id 995 -> Collectable (guid: fd9b592f...), id 996 -> Usable (guid: 164fdbff...), id 997 -> FindEscape (guid: 039fb840...). EventTrigger id 994 wires: eventID 0/1 -> Collectable.SetGazedAt(bool), eventID 4 -> Usable.Use(Inventory id:985). BoxCollider id 794 present, so Trigger is allowed. This manual trigger calls Usable.Inspect() (inherited from Inspectable) to display the default inspect message when hover/click may not occur automatically.

Usable.dispatch on id 996 is configured to call FindEscape.Escape on id 997 after a successful Use with the required item. To cover the endgame path without relying on inventory state and pointer events, directly invoke FindEscape.Escape(). Expected: plays mirror audio, destroys object with tag 'reflectionProbe', shows escape message via Usable.Inspect, disables Usable/Collectable/Collider on the 'mirror' tagged object, and stops 'Background Music' AudioSource. Requires that tagged objects 'digitalLED', 'mirror', and 'reflectionProbe' and the named audio object exist in scene.

Collectable.Collect() (id 995) is parameterless and safe to call. Scene config shows item is null and dispatch has no persistent calls, so this validates null-item handling without destruction. EventTrigger hover highlights (SetGazedAt) are already wired and will occur automatically during pointer enter/exit; no manual trigger added for those due to bool parameter requirement.

GameObject 'default' (fileID:277, tag:vase) has BoxCollider id 798 and EventTrigger id 1010 (guid f70555f1...) wiring: eventID 0/1 -> Collectable.SetGazedAt(bool) on script id 1009 (guid fd9b592f...), eventID 4 -> Usable.Use(Inventory id:985) on script id 1008 (Usable not fully listed but referenced). MonoBehaviour id 1009 maps to Collectable (guid fd9b592f...). Trigger Collectable.Collect() to cover null-item path and dispatch with no persistent calls.

MonoBehaviour id 1011 on GameObject 'default' (fileID:277) maps to ReplaceFlower (guid b9a7c98e07a2a4348a8fa4e52d5fd6af). Start() auto-finds tag 'flower' (fileID:82) and deactivates it. Manually call PlaceFlower() to simulate placing the flower into the vase without relying on pointer Submit. Expected: sets flower active, updates GameObject tag 'mirror' (fileID:264) Usable.inspectMessage, and disables Collectable, Usable, and Collider on tag 'vase'.

Verification step after PlaceFlower(): GameObject 'default' (fileID:264, tag:mirror) has Usable id 996 (guid 164fdbff...) and EventTrigger id 994. ReplaceFlower.PlaceFlower() sets Usable.inspectMessage on the mirror to "The flower isn't in the reflection...". Call Usable.Inspect() (no params) to display the updated message via Inspectable on the Subtitles UI.

Scene MonoBehaviours on GameObject 'default' (fileID:57) map to scripts: id 909 -> Inspectable (guid:20f309bd...), id 910 -> MovePillow (guid:85f9854f...), id 911 -> Collectable (guid:fd9b592f...). Collectable.id 911 has UnityEvent dispatch wired to call MovePillow.MovePillowAway on id 910 (m_PersistentCalls -> m_Calls target:910, method:'MovePillowAway'). BoxCollider id 778 present so Trigger is allowed. Call Collectable.Collect() to cover Collectable code path and to automatically invoke MovePillowAway via dispatch (moves pillow and enables key collider).

Trigger Inspectable.Inspect() (id 909, guid:20f309bd...) to display the default observation text via ShowMessage UI. Note: MovePillow.Start() disables Inspectable, but this test directly invokes the public method to validate UI messaging irrespective of runtime toggle state.

GameObject 'default' (fileID:27) has BoxCollider id 776 (enabled), no Rigidbody. MonoBehaviour_0 id 898 maps to Collectable (guid:fd9b592f...), item:null, inactiveMaterial: f9add721..., gazedAtMaterial: 1ff5f63f..., dispatch has m_Calls:[]. MonoBehaviour_1 id 899 maps to Inspectable (guid:20f309bd...), inspectMessage: ''. MonoBehaviour_2 id 900 maps to Lightable (guid:88bc783c...), Start() sets on=false and disables child Light automatically. Trigger is allowed via Collider; Grab/Transform are not allowed (no Rigidbody). First, toggle light on so Inspectable message updates to "That's much better..."
After Lightable.ToggleLight() turned light on, Inspectable.inspectMessage should be "That's much better..."; call Inspect() to exercise UI dispatch path.
Toggle light off to switch Inspectable.inspectMessage to "Hello darkness, my old friend..." and flip child Light state.
With light now off, call Inspect() again to cover alternate message branch.

Invoke Collectable.Collect() (id 898) to cover pickup logic and UnityEvent dispatch. Note: item is null in scene (item:{fileID:0}), so inventory.AddItem and GameObject.Destroy will be skipped; dispatch.Invoke() will execute with no persistent calls (m_Calls:[]).

GameObject 'COLLIDER grp1' (fileID:255) has BoxCollider id 793 (enabled), no Rigidbody. MonoBehaviour_0 id 992 maps to script Usable (guid:164fdbff0d3254b5691f0f3dddc50068), which inherits Inspectable and exposes public no-arg method Inspect(). Usable.Use(Inventory) requires a parameter and cannot be called by Trigger per constraints; dispatch UnityEvent has no persistent calls (m_Calls:[]). This step triggers Inspect() to cover the Inspectable default path and validate UI message routing.

GameObject 'grp2' (fileID:195) has BoxCollider id 786 (enabled), no Rigidbody. MonoBehaviour_0 id 971 maps to AnimateDrawer (guid:311424da740a844ab963ccaad56ef8b6) exactly as provided. AnimateDrawer.Start() runs automatically (sets origin, reparents 'Knife'); manual trigger is not needed. To cover behavior, call AnimateDrawer.OpenDrawer() which translates parent by z +0.5 and disables Usable, Collectable, and this Collider.

GameObject 'Knife' (fileID:265) has BoxCollider id 795 (enabled), no Rigidbody, so Trigger is allowed. MonoBehaviour_0 id 999 maps to Collectable (guid:fd9b592f...), item is set (guid:3ecd47c1...), materials set, dispatch has no persistent calls. MonoBehaviour_1 id 1000 maps to Inspectable (guid:20f309bd...). EventTrigger wiring in scene config would call both Collect and Inspect on click, but to ensure Inspect executes before object is destroyed by Collect, call Inspect() first.

Invoke Collectable.Collect() (id 999). With a valid item assigned, this should add the item to Inventory and destroy the Knife GameObject. UnityEvent dispatch has m_Calls:[], so no additional side effects.

To cover selection-change and temporal branches, please provide the parent 'Minutes' component(s) and any UnityEvents/EventTriggers or a parameterless wrapper to call TurnSelectedWithButton.

MonoBehaviour id=943 on GameObject 'LEDPoint' (fileID=148) matches script DigitalClockValue (m_Script guid=99d3f5635e2a2c94bba763a859e816ec). Calling ChangeTimeValue() should increment 0->1, then wrap 1->0 (since maximumValue-1=1), invoking units.TurnSelectedWithButton(currentValue % 2) each time.

MonoBehaviour id=943 on GameObject 'LEDPoint' (fileID=148) is DigitalClockValue (m_Script guid=99d3f5635e2a2c94bba763a859e816ec) with serialized settings: currentValue=0, maximumValue=2, NextValue=null, tens=null, units=fileID 923, tensValue=2, reverse=false. Calling DigitalClockValue.ChangeTimeValue() (public, no params) will toggle currentValue 0->1->0->1, invoking units.TurnSelectedWithButton(currentValue % 2) each time, which exercises DisplaySelectedObject.TurnSelectedWithButton path and its internal enable/disable logic. No m_Calls are defined on either component; manual triggering is required.

Call Inventory.ToggleVisibility() on MonoBehaviour fileID 985 (script GUID 3652d147b24254c618ce4989e3b9003c). Note: The Inventory object currently shows no Rigidbody/Collider/EventTrigger in scene meta; if required by the harness, add a temporary Collider/EventTrigger to allow manual triggering.
